meanings.definition: A small cardboard folder containing matches.
meanings.sent1: I always keep a matchbook in my pocket in case I need to light a candle.
meanings.sent2: The waiter handed me a matchbook to use for the fireplace.
meanings.sent3: When the magician pulled a rabbit out of the hat, it was actually a matchbook in disguise!
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like a matchbook in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The matchbook burst into flames, illuminating the room with a warm glow.

meanings.definition: A small cardboard folder used to light fires.
meanings.sent1: My dad always carries a matchbook when we go camping to start the campfire.
meanings.sent2: The matchbook ignited the bonfire with a flick of the wrist.
meanings.sent3: The matchbook and the firewood had a race to see who could light the fire first.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like striking a matchbook in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The matchbook sparked a flame that danced gracefully in the night.
